snippet: The Transportation Department said Monday that airlines collected $3.5 billion in bag fees last year, a 5 percent increase over 2013.
abstract: Transportation Dept reports airlines collected $3.5 billion in bag fees in 2014, up 5 percent 2013, and $3 billion in reservation-change fees, up 6 percent; profits at 27 airlines rose to $14.6 billion from $11.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: The Transportation Department said Monday that airlines collected $3.5 billion in bag fees last year, a 5 percent increase over 2013.

headline.main: Fees and Low Fuel Prices Keep Airline Profits Rising
headline.print_headline: Fees and Low Fuel Prices Keep Airline Profits Rising
